H0.text: Genes are the factor that can also control traits, alongside multiple alleles.

H1.text: Chromosomes are the multiple entities that may control traits, in addition to multiple alleles.

H2.text: Lesions are a factor that, alongside multiple alleles, may control traits.

H3.text: Eggs may also be controlled by multiple alleles or multiple eggs when considering traits.

A4.text: Each gene specifies a particular trait with a different sequence of a gene (alleles) giving rise to different phenotypes.
